header.subtitleStart: This is not about a few unlucky teachers.

cta.quote: "But if teachers are paid 2.8 million, it is indeed bad. Better modify to work at Amazon. The truly smart ones won't want to be there. Teachers will determine our future."
cta.author: Purbaya Yudi Sadewa

quote.text: "If we pay a teacher Rp 10 million a month, I am sure those who wanted to work at Gojek, Google, Amazon‚Äîthey will turn to teaching."
quote.author: Gita Wirjawan

salarySpectrum.title: Compare It Yourself
salarySpectrum.subtitle: Teacher salary spectrum: from the lowest to global standards

points.1: Below minimum wage, below poverty line
points.2: Can be fired anytime without protection

points.0: Paid far less than other professions
points.1: Paid far less than teachers in neighboring countries
points.2: Teaching the future generation, given wages of the past

footer.part1: The root problem is the same:

ervina-ntt.title: 6 Kilometers Through the Forest
ervina-ntt.story: Every morning, Ervina cuts through the forest and steep roads for 6 km. Her knees often tremble on the slopes, but she keeps walking because the school in that remote hamlet has no other teachers.
ervina-ntt.quote: I am tired, my knees often tremble... but if I don't come, the children here won't have a teacher.

nining-banten.title: Living in a School Toilet
nining-banten.story: After her house collapsed, Nining and her family lived in a former school toilet. A place where people dispose of waste was transformed into a place to rest and raise children.
nining-banten.quote: Sometimes I am ashamed if students know their teacher lives next to the WC. But if I stop, who will support my children?

alvi-sukabumi.title: Scavenging After Teaching
alvi-sukabumi.story: 36 years of service. In the morning writing on the blackboard, in the afternoon picking up plastic bottles. His students often kiss his hand while he is scavenging trash.
alvi-sukabumi.quote: In the morning I write students' names. In the afternoon I write prices of used bottles. I want my students to have better jobs than their teacher.

ribut-lumajang.title: Renting Dance Costumes
ribut-lumajang.story: 21 years of service, traveling 18 km every day. His salary is spent on gasoline. He survives by renting out dance costumes he sews himself.
ribut-lumajang.quote: Every time I want to quit, I remember the faces of children dancing on stage. Gasoline might run out, but my pride does not.
